questions.question: What is a computer network?
choices: A single computer with multiple programs
A group of interconnected devices that can communicate and share resources
A type of computer operating system
questions.answer: A group of interconnected devices that can communicate and share resources

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key component of a network?
What type of network typically covers a city or large campus?
Which network topology connects all devices to a single cable?
What is the main advantage of a star topology?
choices: Failure of one connection doesn't affect others
questions.answer: Failure of one connection doesn't affect others

questions.question: Which network type is best suited for connecting multiple countries?
What is a potential disadvantage of a ring topology?
choices: Failure of one device can affect the entire network
questions.answer: Failure of one device can affect the entire network

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a WAN?
choices: An office network in a single building

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a network protocol?
choices: To provide a set of rules for communication between devices
questions.answer: To provide a set of rules for communication between devices

questions.question: In the context of networks, what is a node?
choices: Any device connected to the network
questions.answer: Any device connected to the network

questions.question: Which network type would be most appropriate for connecting computers within a single office?
What is a potential advantage of implementing a bus topology?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a LAN?
What is the main function of a router in a network?
choices: To forward data packets between computer networks
questions.answer: To forward data packets between computer networks

questions.question: Which network topology is most resilient to single cable failures?
What is the typical maximum range of a LAN?
Which of the following is a potential application of a MAN in Dili, Timor-Leste?
choices: Connecting two computers in a home
Linking university campuses across the city
Connecting to websites hosted in other countries
Networking within a single government building
questions.answer: Linking university campuses across the city

questions.question: What is a key advantage of a WAN over a LAN?
choices: Ability to connect geographically distant locations
questions.answer: Ability to connect geographically distant locations

questions.question: Which network type would be most suitable for connecting all government buildings in Timor-Leste?
What is a potential disadvantage of a bus topology?
Which of the following is NOT a common application of networks in Timor-Leste's development?
What is the primary difference between a MAN and a WAN?
Which network topology provides equal access for all devices?
What is a key challenge in expanding network infrastructure in rural areas of Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of demand for internet services

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical characteristic of a WAN?
choices: Limited to a single organization's use
questions.answer: Limited to a single organization's use

questions.question: What is the main advantage of a ring topology?
Which of the following would be considered a node in a network?
choices: A printer connected to the network
questions.answer: A printer connected to the network

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of improved networking infrastructure for education in Timor-Leste?
Which network type is most likely to use public communication infrastructure?
What is the main function of a switch in a network?
choices: To connect multiple devices and forward data to the correct destination
questions.answer: To connect multiple devices and forward data to the correct destination
